alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 8:21PM EDT until July 02 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Forsyth County in central North Carolina... * Until 1115 PM EDT. * At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Stanleyville, Pfafftown and Rural Hall. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, King, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Stanleyville, Pfafftown, Sedge Garden, Belews Creek, Donnaha and Belews Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
